H0.text: Erosion is the Earth movement that results in day and night.

H1.text: Deposition is the Earth movement that results in day and night.

H2.text: Revolution is the Earth movement that results in day and night.

H3.text: Rotation is the Earth movement that results in day and night.

A4.text: Earth rotates once in about 24 hours with respect to the Sun

A5.text: Multiplying by (180°/π radians) × (86,400 seconds/day) yields 360.9856 °/day, indicating that Earth rotates more than 360 degrees relative to the fixed stars in one solar day
